# Subscription Agreement Template
## [FUND NAME] LP

---

**CONFIDENTIAL**

This Subscription Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into as of _____________, 20__ by and between:

**[FUND NAME] LP**, a Delaware limited partnership (the "Partnership" or "Fund")

and

**The undersigned investor** (the "Subscriber" or "Limited Partner")

---

## ARTICLE 1: SUBSCRIPTION

### 1.1 Capital Commitment

The Subscriber hereby subscribes for a limited partnership interest in the Fund in the amount of:

**Capital Commitment**: $________________

**Minimum Investment**: $250,000 (or such lesser amount as the General Partner may accept)

### 1.2 Payment

The Subscriber agrees to fund the Capital Commitment as follows:
- **Initial Contribution**: 100% due within 10 business days of acceptance
- **Additional Contributions**: N/A (single funding vehicle)

### 1.3 Acceptance

This subscription is subject to acceptance by the General Partner. The General Partner reserves the right to reject any subscription in whole or in part, for any reason or no reason.

---

## ARTICLE 2: REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

The Subscriber represents and warrants as follows:

### 2.1 Accredited Investor Status

The Subscriber is an "accredited investor" as defined in Rule 501(a) of Regulation D under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, by virtue of satisfying one or more of the following criteria (**check all that apply**):

**For Individuals:**

- [ ] (a) Net worth exceeding $1,000,000, individually or with spouse/spousal equivalent, excluding value of primary residence

- [ ] (b) Individual income exceeding $200,000 (or joint income with spouse exceeding $300,000) in each of the last two years, with reasonable expectation of same for current year

- [ ] (c) Holder of Series 7, Series 65, or Series 82 license in good standing

- [ ] (d) "Knowledgeable employee" of the Fund (as defined in Rule 3c-5 under the Investment Company Act)

**For Entities:**

- [ ] (e) Corporation, partnership, LLC, or business trust with total assets exceeding $5,000,000, not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring this interest

- [ ] (f) Entity in which all equity owners are individually accredited investors

- [ ] (g) Trust with total assets exceeding $5,000,000, not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring this interest, and directed by a sophisticated person

- [ ] (h) Bank, insurance company, registered investment company, business development company, or small business investment company

- [ ] (i) Employee benefit plan with total assets exceeding $5,000,000, or with investment decisions made by a plan fiduciary that is a bank, insurance company, or registered investment adviser

---

### 2.2 Qualified Purchaser Status (If Applicable)

**Check if applicable** (required for 3(c)(7) funds):

- [ ] The Subscriber is a "qualified purchaser" as defined in Section 2(a)(51) of the Investment Company Act of 1940, by virtue of:

  - [ ] (i) Natural person with not less than $5,000,000 in investments
  
  - [ ] (ii) Family company with not less than $5,000,000 in investments
  
  - [ ] (iii) Trust with not less than $5,000,000 in investments, not formed for the specific purpose of acquiring this interest
  
  - [ ] (iv) Entity, acting for own account or other qualified purchasers, that owns and invests on a discretionary basis not less than $25,000,000 in investments

---

### 2.3 Investment Intent & Understanding

The Subscriber represents and warrants that:

- [ ] (a) The Subscriber is acquiring this interest for investment purposes only, for the Subscriber's own account, and not with a view to resale or distribution

- [ ] (b) The Subscriber understands that the interests have not been registered under the Securities Act of 1933 and cannot be sold unless registered or an exemption is available

- [ ] (c) The Subscriber has received, read, and understands the Private Placement Memorandum dated ____________

- [ ] (d) The Subscriber has had the opportunity to ask questions of the General Partner and has received satisfactory answers

- [ ] (e) The Subscriber can bear the economic risk of losing the entire investment

- [ ] (f) The Subscriber has such knowledge and experience in financial and business matters to evaluate the merits and risks of this investment

---

### 2.4 Leveraged ETF Acknowledgment

**IMPORTANT - MUST INITIAL:**

The Subscriber specifically acknowledges and understands that:

_____ (initial) The Fund invests in leveraged exchange-traded funds, including ProShares UltraPro QQQ (TQQQ), which seeks 3x daily returns of the NASDAQ-100 Index

_____ (initial) Due to daily compounding, leveraged ETF returns over periods longer than one day may differ significantly from the multiple of the index return

_____ (initial) Volatility decay can cause substantial losses even when the underlying index is flat or positive

_____ (initial) I have read FINRA Regulatory Notice 09-31 regarding leveraged ETF suitability

_____ (initial) The Fund's use of leveraged ETFs is consistent with my risk tolerance and investment objectives

---

### 2.5 Source of Funds / AML Representations

The Subscriber represents that:

- [ ] (a) The funds being invested are not derived from any illegal activity

- [ ] (b) The Subscriber is not a Specially Designated National (SDN) or blocked person under OFAC regulations

- [ ] (c) The Subscriber is not a foreign shell bank or acting on behalf of a foreign shell bank

- [ ] (d) The Subscriber will promptly notify the General Partner of any changes to the above representations

---

## ARTICLE 3: POWER OF ATTORNEY

The Subscriber hereby irrevocably constitutes and appoints the General Partner as the Subscriber's attorney-in-fact to:

(a) Execute and file any amendments to the Certificate of Limited Partnership

(b) Execute any agreements or instruments necessary to admit the Subscriber as a Limited Partner

(c) Take any other action necessary to carry out the purposes of the Partnership

This power of attorney is coupled with an interest and shall survive the disability or incapacity of the Subscriber.

---

## ARTICLE 4: MISCELLANEOUS

### 4.1 Governing Law


This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the State of Delaware.

### 4.2 Entire Agreement

This Agreement, together with the Limited Partnership Agreement and Private Placement Memorandum, constitutes the entire agreement between the parties.

### 4.3 Amendment

This Agreement may not be modified except by written instrument signed by both parties.

---
